action.action-desc: Ms. Klobuchar (for herself, Mr. Hoeven, Ms. Smith, and Mr. Cramer) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To establish rural export centers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promoting Rural Exports Act of 2025.

paragraph.text: Rural businesses are often located far from information clusters and major transportation corridors.
Because of their location, rural businesses face higher barriers to accessing international markets.

A dedicated National Rural Export Center within the United States and Foreign Commercial Service, and regional rural export centers, providing business- and product-specific support can help companies in the United States looking to export their products.

The term Assistant Secretary means the Assistant Secretary of Commerce and Director General of the United States and Foreign Commercial Service appointed pursuant to section 2301(a)(2) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 (15 U.S.C. 4721(a)(2)).
The term Commercial Service means the United States and Foreign Commercial Service established under section 2301(a)(1) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 (15 U.S.C. 4721(a)(1)).

subsection.header: Establishment of the National Rural Export Center

paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Assistant Secretary shall establish a National Rural Export Center for the purpose of providing businesses located in rural areas in the United States with resources to help those businesses export their products.

paragraph.header: Location of the National Rural Export Center

subparagraph.text: The National Rural Export Center shall be established at an office of the Commercial Service in the United States in existence before the date of the enactment of this Act.
In selecting a location for the National Rural Export Center, the Assistant Secretary shall give preference—

clause.text: based on expertise and operations at Commercial Service offices that support rural businesses exporting to new markets before the date of the enactment of this Act; and
to such offices not located in major metropolitan areas.

subparagraph.text: Any researcher or staff directly supporting the operation of the National Rural Export Center shall be primarily based at the National Rural Export Center.

subsection.header: Establishment of regional rural export centers

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Assistant Secretary shall establish not more than 9 regional rural export centers for the purposes of providing businesses located in rural areas within their regions with resources to help those businesses export their products.
The programs, activities, and expenditures of the regional rural export centers shall be subordinate to and delegated by the National Rural Export Center.
The National Rural Export Center and regional rural export centers shall—

subparagraph.text: provide in-depth, customized, and actionable market research services that—

clause.text: a business may opt into based on need; and

subclause.text: focused on actionable and measurable results for a business;
based on high-quality data, including data from international trade association subscription databases; and
based on market analysis and export services of the Commercial Service available before the date of the enactment of this Act, including the Rural Export Center Research Program; and

subparagraph.text: conduct strategic planning and export support services for rural businesses as needed.

paragraph.text: To measure the effectiveness of the National Rural Export Center and regional rural export centers, the centers shall collect and make available data on—

subparagraph.text: the number of businesses that sign up for market research assistance;
the number of export assistance services a business engages in following the research assistance, including—

clause.text: other services facilitated by the Commercial Service; and

subparagraph.text: the total monetary value of exports facilitated by the services provided by the centers.

paragraph.text: The National Rural Export Center and each regional rural export center shall maintain an internet website that includes—

subparagraph.text: best practices for rural businesses beginning to evaluate export opportunities; and
appropriate contact information for staff at the center.
